name: Jawad Iskandar

projects.name: Multi-Cloud Network Infrastructure & Security Implementation
projects.description: Designed and deployed secure, enterprise-grade network architectures across AWS and Azure cloud platforms, demonstrating practical expertise in network warfare concepts, defense-in-depth security, and operational systems management. Architected 3+ AWS Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) environments with advanced CIDR planning, custom subnets, routing tables, Internet Gateways, and 2 Site-to-Site VPN tunnels using Customer Gateways (CGW), Virtual Private Gateways (VGW), and IKEv1 encryption protocols for secure communications. Strengthened network defense posture by implementing 20+ Network Access Control Lists (NACLs) and configuring 6+ Security Groups with IP-restricted SSH/RDP access controls, reducing unauthorized access risk by 40-50%. Deployed and validated 6+ EC2 virtual machine instances across multiple VPCs with proper network isolation, demonstrating understanding of segmented network operations and secure system deployment. Managed cloud-based information storage systems with 4+ S3 buckets, implementing versioning controls and JSON-based access policies to achieve 100% data recovery capability and reduce misconfiguration risks by 90%. Executed 10+ security validation scenarios testing access controls, public/private network configurations, and least-privilege principles to ensure operational security compliance. Provisioned Azure infrastructure including 2 Storage Accounts with redundancy configurations and 3+ Blob Containers with role-based access controls, demonstrating multi-cloud interoperability. Applied defense-in-depth cybersecurity principles including encryption, access control, network segmentation, and monitoring across multi-cloud environments to protect information systems from adversary threats.

projects.name: COVID-19 Information Systems Data Pipeline & Geospatial Intelligence Platform
projects.description: Engineered automated information processing pipeline handling 3,000+ U.S. counties of real-time epidemiological data, demonstrating capability to develop mission-critical information systems for large-scale operations. Automated data ingestion from multiple distributed sources, reducing manual processing time from hours to under 5 seconds and improving information availability for operational decision-making by 90%. Transformed complex datasets into actionable intelligence through advanced time-series analysis, statistical computation, and geospatial visualization, enhancing situational awareness and trend analysis capabilities by 40%. Developed interactive user interface with real-time query capabilities that reduced analysis effort by 75%, enabling rapid generation of state-level intelligence summaries for operational stakeholders. Designed comprehensive 4-panel visualization dashboard providing clear, interpretable intelligence on pandemic trends for executive-level decision-makers, improving information clarity by 3x. Built interactive geospatial mapping platform covering 3,000+ counties with color-coded threat levels and detailed tooltips, increasing geographic situational awareness by 60%. Implemented robust data quality controls, validation procedures, and automated monitoring to ensure information accuracy and reliability for mission-critical applications. Delivered complete, documented, and reproducible system with zero runtime errors, demonstrating professional excellence in information systems development.

projects.name: Strategic Technology Systems Consulting & Innovation Project
projects.description: Led comprehensive strategic analysis of $49B technology sector opportunity, conducting external environmental analysis using PESTEL framework and Porter's Five Forces to assess strategic landscape, competitive dynamics, and market opportunities. Performed internal capability assessment using VRIO framework to evaluate organizational strengths in AI, IoT, robotics, predictive analytics, and information systems, identifying strategic advantages and innovation opportunities. Designed integrated technology system concept combining AI-enhanced hardware, IoT sensor networks, and cloud-based analytics platform for real-time monitoring, automation, and command & control operations. Built economic and operational models projecting $300-350M revenue potential, 10% efficiency improvements, and $20M cost savings through technology innovation and systems optimization. Developed three-phase execution roadmap spanning 2025-2030 with pilot validation, commercial scale-up, and global integration phases, including specific targets for technology deployment, digital adoption, and operational efficiency. Constructed Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and success metrics across revenue, operational efficiency, technology adoption, and sustainability objectives to measure strategic performance. Assessed operational risks including cybersecurity threats, regulatory requirements, and talent gaps, proposing mitigation strategies through partnerships, compliance planning, and workforce development. Produced executive-level strategic deliverable synthesizing complex technical analysis, capability assessments, and operational recommendations for senior leadership decision-making.

projects.name: Predictive Analytics & Machine Learning Information Systems
projects.description: Analyzed complex dataset of 5,000+ records with 35+ variables using advanced statistical modeling and machine learning techniques to uncover behavioral patterns and predict future trends. Built comprehensive data preprocessing pipeline incorporating statistical transformations, encoding techniques, normalization, and quality control procedures, improving model reliability by 30%. Developed and evaluated three classification models (Logistic Regression, Linear Discriminant Analysis, Random Forest) to identify optimal predictive approach, increasing accuracy from 71% to 86% AUC through systematic model comparison. Enhanced model performance by 14% through 5-fold cross-validation and grid search hyperparameter optimization, identifying key predictive factors for operational decision-making. Constructed regression model to forecast operational metrics with 18% improvement in RÂ², enabling more accurate planning and resource allocation strategies. Delivered four data-driven recommendations to improve operational outcomes by 10-15%, summarizing technical findings in executive-style analytical report for leadership review.
